attributes.action: make it legal that people who have been involved in a failed discrimination plea against a previous employer, declare so at their interview (at the request of the employer)
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This would cover sexual discrimination actions aswell as racial discrimination actions.

In the same way that potential employees are asked to provide information regarding if they have a criminal background, it should be legal to ask an employee if they've ever been involved in a failed discrimination action (against a previous employer).

Any incorrect statement/lie from the potential employee would mean that the employer (legally) could stop any offer of employment it had made.

This is to help protect businesses from serial abusers of the sexual/racial discrimination laws.
